meanings.definition: Capable of being maintained or preserved.
meanings.sent1: The old house was easily maintainable with regular cleaning and repairs.
meanings.sent2: It is important to choose a maintainable hairstyle that you can manage on a daily basis.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a self-cleaning house is intriguing but not yet maintainable.
meanings.sent4: Her maintainable routine was like a well-oiled machine, never faltering.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a maintainable paradise, always blooming and thriving.

meanings.definition: Able to be supported or upheld.
meanings.sent1: The bridge was designed to be strong and maintainable under heavy traffic.
meanings.sent2: A good leader should have maintainable values that guide their decisions.
meanings.sent3: The friendship between the two was so maintainable, always there for each other.
meanings.sent4: Her maintainable beliefs were like a sturdy shield against criticism.
meanings.sent5: The team's spirit was maintainable, never wavering even in tough times.

meanings.definition: Able to be continued or sustained.
meanings.sent1: The project's success was due to its maintainable progress over time.
meanings.sent2: A healthy lifestyle includes maintainable habits like regular exercise and balanced diet.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were so maintainable, keeping the audience laughing all night.
meanings.sent4: Their maintainable enthusiasm was like a constant source of energy for the team.
meanings.sent5: The tradition was maintainable through generations, always cherished and respected.
